document_data.name: Tragedy's Grotto
document_data.mainbody: '''Tragedy's Grotto''' was a small hollow and shrine to [[Ilmater]], the Crying God, and [[St. Ulrach]] found in the city of [[Loudwater]] in the [[Delimbiyr Vale]].
document_data.Location: The grotto was tucked away between some villas and merchant compounds, in a spot easily overlooked and easily avoidedâ€”just as the wealthy citizens of this neighborhood preferred.
document_data.Description: Only {{SI|90|ft|long=yes}} at its widest, it was a narrow grotto between three tree-covered knolls atop which the rear walls of the villas and compounds stood. A fast-flowing stream ran down the middle and was fed by two tributaries. At the heart of the grotto, the stream widened into a small pool, {{SI|20|ft|long=yes}} wide. At the center of this pool stood a statue of St. Ulrach, which served as the shrine to Ilmater. Although unkempt and grim, it was nevertheless a very picturesque place.
document_data.Activities: The monks of the [[Monastery of St. Ulrach]] came regularly but not frequently to tend to Tragedy's Grotto in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Rumors & Legends: It was commonly believed to be haunted by the spirits of the unquiet dead. In particular, there was a story of [[Brother Sheer|a ghost]] that wandered Tragedy's Grotto after each [[Shieldmeet]]. Those who followed it were said to find great treasure, or else sorrow and doom.
